- My position (row = 6, col = 9) has a chase enemy '@' located at (row = 5, col = 0) and additional directional enemies (% at 3,4), & at (12,14).

In the current state, my avatar is at (row = 7, col = 9), and I have successfully moved down from the previous position. I need to assess the new situation and determine an appropriate action.

Evaluation of the Current State:
- The area around my position has a directional enemy above at (row = 6, col = 9) where I just came from and chase enemies at (row = 5, col = 3) and (row = 8, col = 3).
- Since I remain in the same column, I have the potential to move left or right in my next action to evade enemies and avoid being attacked.

Considering my strategies of maintaining distance and prioritizing enemy threats, I should move left to (row = 7, col = 8) to create more space from the nearby chase enemy and also allow myself to adjust better in the next turn.

Executing the action:

``` Action: 1 ```
This left movement allows me to increase distance relative to the threats and aligns with the strategic recommendations of prioritizing safety and distance.
